text: Consider the following relational schemas: « Employees (Emp_ID, First Name, Last_Name, Salary, Dept_ID, Designation, Address) « Departments (Dept_ID, Dept_Name, Dept_Location) Assume that Dept_ID references Departments (Dept_ID). What will be the outcome of the query that follows? SELECT Dept_ID, MIN (salary) FROM Employees GROUP BY Dept_ID HAVING MIN(salary) > (SELECT MIN(Salary) FROM Employees WHERE Dept_ID = 100); (@) It finds Department ID with minimum salary of employee greater than salary of all the employee of department 100. (b)It finds the minimum salaried employee from each department whose salary is greater than salary of all the employees in department 100. (©) It finds the minimum salaried employee from each department whose salary is greater than the ‘minimum salaried employee of department 100. (@1t finds Department ID with minimum salary of employee greater than minimum salaried employees of department 100
